meanings.definition: To show excessive fondness or love for someone
meanings.sent1: She would dote on her little puppy, giving it treats and cuddles all day.
meanings.sent2: Parents often dote on their children, showering them with affection and praise.
meanings.sent3: The old man would dote on his antique collection, polishing each piece with care.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes would dote on the beautiful sunset, capturing every color and hue.
meanings.sent5: The grandmother would dote on her grandchildren, cherishing every moment spent with them.

meanings.definition: To be foolishly or excessively fond of someone
meanings.sent1: He would dote on his favorite sports team, even when they lost every game.
meanings.sent2: Teenagers often dote on celebrities, following their every move on social media.
meanings.sent3: The cat would dote on the laser pointer, chasing it around the room for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her heart would dote on the memories of her first love, unable to forget the past.
meanings.sent5: The child would dote on their new toy, refusing to let it out of sight.

meanings.definition: An act of showing excessive love or fondness for someone
meanings.sent1: Her constant dote on her pet rabbit was evident in the way she pampered it with treats.
meanings.sent2: The public display of dote towards the famous actor was overwhelming, with fans screaming for autographs.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's dote on her doll was so strong that she carried it everywhere she went.
meanings.sent4: The dote of the elderly couple towards each other was heartwarming, as they held hands and smiled.
meanings.sent5: The dote of the chef towards his signature dish was clear in the meticulous way he prepared it.
